{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2016}} {{spanish name|Quintero|Quintero}} {{Use British English|date=May 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Josimar Quintero | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Josimar Aldair Quintero Quintero{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|02|3|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Guayaquil]], Ecuador | height = 1.63 m | position = [[Midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Lleida Esportiu]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) | clubnumber = | youthyears1 = 2005–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] | youthyears2 = 2013–2017 | youthclubs2 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | years1 = 2017– | clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2017–2018 | clubs2 = → [[FC Rostov|Rostov]] (loan) | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2018 | clubs3 = → [[Betis Deportivo Balompié|Betis B]] (loan) | caps3 = 6 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = → [[Lleida Esportiu]] (loan) | caps4 = 12 | goals4 = 0 | club-update = 3 March 2019 | ntupdate = }} '''Josimar Aldair Quintero Quintero''' ({{IPA-es|ɟʝosiˈmaɾ kinˈteɾo}}; born 3 February 1997) is an Ecuadorian professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Lleida Esportiu]] on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Born in [[Guayaquil]], Quintero moved to Spain with his family at the age of five.{{Cite news |title=Chelsea set to sign Barcelona starlet Josimar Quintero: "The new Antonio Valencia" |url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/blog/chelsea-set-to-sign-barcelona-starlet-josimar-quintero-dubbed-the-new-antonio-valencia/ |publisher=101 Great Goals |date=21 April 2013 |accessdate=30 September 2017}} He joined ''[[La Masia]]'', the youth academy of [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]], at the age of eight. In 2013, it was reported that [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and [[Tottenham Hotspur]] were interested in securing his services,{{cite web|title=Meet the 'next Antonio Valencia' who has 'agreed' to swap Barcelona for Chelsea|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2013/04/20/meet-the-next-antonio-valencia-who-has-agreed-to-swap-barcelona/|publisher=HITC|accessdate=4 October 2017}} but Quintero opted to join English club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in July 2014.{{cite web|title=Josimar Quintero|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/on-loan-players/josimar-quintero.html|publisher=Chelsea F.C.|accessdate=4 October 2017}} However, due to paperwork and visa issues, Quintero was unable to play a competitive match for Chelsea until he turned 18.{{Cite news |title=Josimar Quintero |url=http://thechels.info/wiki/Josimar_Quintero |publisher=TheChels.info |accessdate=30 September 2017}} During the 2014–15 under-21 campaign, Quintero became a key figure in [[Adrian Viveash]]'s starting eleven, featuring eighteen times and scoring once in all competitions. He scored his first goal for the Chelsea academy in an [[UEFA Youth League]] encounter against Portuguese club [[FC Porto|Porto]].{{cite web|title=South American Chelsea prospect Josimar Quintero nets first goal since Barcelona exit|url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2015/09/29/south-american-chelsea-prospect-quintero-nets-first-goal-since-b/|publisher=HITC|accessdate=4 October 2017}} Following his debut season in England, Quintero transitioned from a winger to a central midfielder. On 5 July 2017, following reports suggesting Quintero was ready to leave Chelsea, he joined Russian club [[FC Rostov|Rostov]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=Loan move for Quintero |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/loan-move-for-quintero.html |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=5 July 2017 |accessdate=30 September 2017}} On 20 September 2017, Quintero made his Rostov debut during their cup tie against [[FC Volgar Astrakhan|Volgar Astrakhan]], replacing [[Žan Majer]] in their 2–0 away victory.{{Cite news |title=Volgar Astrakhan vs. Rostov|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2017/09/20/russia/cup/volgar-gazprom-astrakhan/fk-rostov-na-donu/2582119/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=20 September 2017 |accessdate=30 September 2017}} On 2 January 2018, Rostov removed Quintero from their official squad list.{{cite web|publisher=[[Russian Premier League]]|url=http://rfpl.org/players/Kintero-Kintero-Hosimar-Aldair|title=Quintero Russian League registration page|date=2 January 2018|language=Russian}} Following his return from Rostov, Quintero joined Spanish club [[Betis Deportivo Balompié|Betis B]] in January 2018 on loan for the remainder of the campaign. The deal also included an option to purchase Quintero at the conclusion of the loan spell.{{Cite news |title=Josimar Quintero, third winter signing of Betis Deportivo |url=http://realbetisbalompie.es/es/noticias/cantera/10782/josimar-quintero-tercer-fichaje-invernal-del-betis |publisher=Betis Deportivo Official Site |date=17 January 2018 |accessdate=17 January 2018}} On 4 March 2018, he made his Betis B debut during their 3–1 away defeat against [[Mérida AD|Mérida]], replacing Jesús Pozo in the 79th minute.{{Cite news |title=Mérida AD vs. Real Betis II |url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2018/03/04/spain/segunda-b/merida-ad/real-betis-ii/2540040/ |publisher=Soccerway |date=4 March 2018 |accessdate=10 March 2018}} On 10 August 2018, Quintero agreed to join Spanish third-tier club [[Lleida Esportiu]] on a season-long loan.{{Cite news |title=El Lleida Esportiu i el Chelsea FC acorden la cessió de Josimar Quintero |url=http://www.lleidaesportiu.cat/node/7496 |publisher=Lleida Esportiu Official Site |date=10 August 2018 |accessdate=10 August 2018}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 14 October 2018.{{Cite news |title=J. Quintero |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/josimar-quintero/420563/ |publisher=Soccerway |accessdate=30 September 2017}}}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="3"|League !colspan="2"|National Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Other !colspan="2"|Total |- !Division!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals!!Apps!!Goals |- |valign="center"|[[FC Rostov|Rostov]] (loan) |[[2017–18 FC Rostov season|2017–18]] |[[Russian Premier League]] |0||0||1||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||1||0 |- |valign="center"|[[Betis Deportivo Balompié|Betis B]] (loan) |[[2017–18 Segunda División B|2017–18]] |[[Segunda División B|2ª B – Group 4]] |6||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||6||0 |- |valign="center"|[[Lleida Esportiu]] (loan) |[[2018–19 Segunda División B|2018–19]] |2ª B – Group 3 |1||0||2||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||3||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career total !7!!0!!3!!0!!0!!0!!0!!0!!10!!0 |} {{reflist|group=lower-alpha}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{Soccerway|id=420563}} {{Lleida Esportiu squad}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Quintero, Josimar}} [[Category:1997 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Guayaquil]] [[Category:Ecuadorian footballers]] [[Category:Association football midfielders]] [[Category:FC Barcelona players]] [[Category:Chelsea F.C. players]] [[Category:FC Rostov players]] [[Category:Real Betis B footballers]] [[Category:Lleida Esportiu footballers]] [[Category:Ecuadorian expatriate footballers]] [[Category:Ecuadorian expatriate sportspeople in Spain]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Spain]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in England]] [[Category:Expatriate footballers in Russia]]
